levelDescription: With the torch in hand you can make out the end of the hallway infront of you.
In the room, there's a desk with a wooden chair and a torch hanging on the wall. It seems the torch isn't bolted to the wall, you might be able to pick it up.
As you enter the hallway, you see there’s corridors to the left, right and in front of you. The sobbing becomes ever so clearer.
As you hold your torch up you catch a glimpse of something shining in front of you down the corridor but the faint sobbing subsides.
On the floor, there's a rusty key in front of your feet
As you hold your torch up you catch a glimpse of something shining to the left of you down the corridor.
The sobbing increases, you can hear it in both your ears.
As you walk forwards the sobbing increases. You walk up to a closed metal gate, to your right is a damp room.
In the room there’s a keyhole on opposite side of the gate.
The sobbing increases, you can see a corridor on your left.
The sobbing becomes significantly louder, you can make out a figure in front of you sitting on the floor.

On the floor, there’s a dark haired girl sitting on the ground, with her head in her hands covering her face. As you walk up and lay your hand on her shoulder, she crumbles into ash. You jump back, shook by the event. In the ash there’s a COLOR? key, you pick it up. Could this be the final piece of the puzzle?
